cannot-curse.context: Balaam unable to curse Israel despite being hired to
cannot-curse.english: How can I damn whom God has not damned?

they-are-blessed.context: God tells Balaam he cannot curse Israel
they-are-blessed.hebrew: לֹא תָאֹר אֶת־הָעָם כִּי בָרוּךְ הוּא
they-are-blessed.english: You must not curse that people, for they are blessed

mah-tovu.context: Balaam's curse becomes a blessing - now a Jewish prayer
mah-tovu.english: How fair are your tents, O Jacob, your dwellings, O Israel!

donkey-speaks.hebrew: מֶה־עָשִׂיתִי לְךָ כִּי הִכִּיתַנִי זֶה שָׁלֹשׁ רְגָלִים
donkey-speaks.english: What have I done to you that you have beaten me these three times?

word-in-mouth.context: Balaam admits he can only speak what God allows
word-in-mouth.hebrew: הֲדָבָר אֲשֶׁר יָשִׂים אֱלֹהִים בְּפִי אֹתוֹ אֲדַבֵּר
word-in-mouth.english: The word that God puts in my mouth, that I must speak

star-from-jacob.context: Balaam's prophecy of Israel's future king
